introduction: In this episode of the MOPS Community Podcast, Dimitri O interviews Apara, cofounder of Arise AI, about the evaluation space, specifically the LLM evaluation space. Apara shares her insights on evaluating LLM systems and the output, as well as the importance of using LLMs as judges. She also discusses her hot takes on finetuning and traditional ML, and her experiences moving from India to Spain and eventually Germany.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction
content: Apara is the cofounder of Arise AI and has been working in the observability space since the traditional MLops days.
She has recently stopped drinking coffee and now prefers machil lattes.
Apara has been a guest at several conferences, including the HomeOps Community Virtual Conference on February 15th and 22nd.
She is known for her work in the LLM evaluation space and has been diving headfirst into this new area.

sections.title: Section 2: LLM Evaluation
content: Apara discusses the importance of evaluating LLM systems and the output.
She emphasizes the need to consider both the retrieval and the rag (output) pieces when evaluating LLM systems.
Apara is bullish on using LLMs as judges to evaluate systems and output.
She believes that LLMs can provide valuable insights into the performance and effectiveness of LLM systems.

sections.title: Section 3: Finetuning and Traditional ML
content: Apara discusses her hot takes on finetuning and traditional ML.
She believes that traditional ML engineers may jump to finetuning without fully understanding the implications.
Apara emphasizes the importance of considering the context and the problem at hand when deciding on the appropriate approach.
She encourages traditional ML engineers to explore other approaches and techniques to improve their models.

sections.title: Section 4: Apara's Journey
content: Apara shares her story about moving from India to Spain and eventually Germany.
She discusses her experiences living in Spain and how it influenced her work in the observability space.
Apara talks about her experiences at the HomeOps Community Virtual Conference and how it helped her connect with the community.
She reflects on her journey and the importance of staying true to oneself and following one's passions.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Apara concludes the episode by emphasizing the importance of staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the LLM evaluation space.
She encourages listeners to explore new approaches and techniques to improve their LLM systems.
Apara thanks the Arise team for supporting the MOPS community since 2020.
She invites listeners to share the episode with one person to help keep the good vibes rolling in the ML community.
